Kaxil Kiuic, A.C. manages the Helen Moyers Biocultural Reserve located in the Bolonchen District of the Puus Region of Yucatan, Mexico. The reserve is a living laboratory where research and education are carried out in an effort to not only acquire knowledge but help sustain the reserve's ecological and cultural resources. It is also a place designed to provide support to the neighboring Maya towns as they confront the challenges of sustaining their own culture and identity.

Micas-Kiuic Venture, A.C. owns the 4,000-acre reserve in Mexico's Yucatan Peninsula where the Kaxil Kiuic Biocultural Reserve program is conducted. The reserve contains a wealth of archaeological sites important to the understanding of ancient and modern Maya culture. The Yucatan Program offers faculty and students a living laboratory where they study the relationships among disciplines as varied as biology, English, business, the environment, and archaeology. The Reserve - which demonstrates connections between economic development, environmental policy, and cultural preservation - has become a national model for interdisciplinary studies.

THESE RELATED ORGANIZATIONS ARE NOT TAX EXEMPT UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE CODE, BECAUSE THEY ARE NOT LOCATED OR OPERATING IN THE UNITED STATES. HOWEVER, IF THESE ORGANIZATIONS WERE TAX EXEMPT UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE CODE WITH THE SAME EXEMPT PURPOSES AS GIA, THESE ORGANIZATIONS WOULD HAVE NO UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME, SINCE ALL OF THEIR INCOME AND ACTIVITIES ARE IDENTICAL IN CHARACTER TO GIA'S TAX-EXEMPT INCOME AND ACTIVITIES. ACCORDINGLY, THESE ROYALTY PAYMENTS ARE NOT TREATED AS UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME FOR GIA UNDER SECTION 512(B)(13) OF THE CODE.
